org.threadly.test.concurrent

Class BlockingTestRunnable

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.threadly.test.concurrent.TestRunnable
      • org.threadly.test.concurrent.BlockingTestRunnable
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class BlockingTestRunnable
extends TestRunnable
    An implementation of TestRunnable which will initially block the running thread with Object.wait() when handleRunStart() is invoked. The thread will remain blocked until unblock() is invoked.
    Since:
    1.0

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BlockingTestRunnable()

      Check if the task has been unblocked yet.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BlockingTestRunnable

        public BlockingTestRunnable()

    • Method Detail

      • handleRunStart

        public void handleRunStart()
                    throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Description copied from class: TestRunnable
        Function to be overloaded by extending classes if more data or operations need to happen at the run point.

        This is also the first call to be made in the runnable, but all necessary TestRunnable actions are in a finally block so it is safe to throw any exceptions necessary here.

        Overrides:
        handleRunStart in class TestRunnable
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - only InterruptedExceptions will be swallowed

      • isUnblocked

        public boolean isUnblocked()
        Check if the task has been unblocked yet.
        Returns:
        true if the thread has been unblocked.

      • unblock

        public void unblock()
        Invoke to unblock any current or future executions for this TestRunnable. Once invoked no future blocking will occur. In general this should be invoked at the end of every test (fail or not) to avoid having left over blocked threads hanging around.
